column4: i have updated the Lib that i know like libdvdcss2,nav4 and read also and tried reinstalling Totem-xine and vlc still does not want to play my DVD what am i missing?
did you run    *
also have you tried mplayer for your dvd's ?
sorry  do you still have mplayer installed?
if you still have mplayer installed open it up and right click the main window  go to Preferences
ok  well we can set up mplayer now if you like

also if you want the person you are talking to to be alerted simply type the first few letters of the name  and hit tab to get the correct nick   this way the text in the person's irc client should turn red or highlighted
which did not install via synaptic?
if you want more info on this stuff you can google   ubuntu restricted formats
yea for sure on the mplayer
ok open that up and right click main window and go to preferences
k next
go under the "Video" tab and choose   xv  X11/Xv
already done
then under "Codecs & demuxer" tab for video codec family = FFmpeg's libavcodec codec family and for audio codec family =  MPEG layer-2, layer-3
close and then reopen mplayer for that to take effect
ok done
that should effectively allow mplayer to play dvd's
gives me error warning MVs no available
yeah you can ignore that  mplayer has been doing that for some time and I have not found the solution
it works here regardless of that error    maybe on an #mplayer channel the fix can be effected or maybe googling it
thanxs alot works now
very cool :)
